meanings.definition: A person or group that removes or destroys plants or trees by pulling them out of the ground.
meanings.sent1: The uprooters worked together to clear the field of all the unwanted plants.
meanings.sent2: The uprooters were hired to clean up the overgrown garden.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous uprooters decided to play a prank by uprooting all the flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The uprooters of the forest, the beavers, transformed the landscape with their tree-cutting skills.
meanings.sent5: The uprooters' impact on the environment was evident as the once lush forest became barren.

meanings.definition: A force or factor that causes displacement or disruption.
meanings.sent1: The storm was a powerful uprooter, tearing trees from the ground with its strong winds.
meanings.sent2: Erosion can be a natural uprooter, slowly changing the landscape over time.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected uprooter of the peaceful town was the arrival of a circus with loud music and bright lights.
meanings.sent4: Change can act as an uprooter, shaking up routines and pushing people out of their comfort zones.
meanings.sent5: The uprooter of tradition, the new technology, revolutionized the way people communicated.
